title: How to Use Tree Diagrams
text: When looking at a tree diagram, it consists of "branches", sometimes labeled with frequencies (whole numbers) or probabilities (fractions). Each branch of the tree represents a "choice" of sorts and each level represents the completion of a choice, and at the bottom of the tree--the leaf--houses the final outcomes. To get to the final outcome, you want to multiply all the probabilities going down the tree from the top to the end of the leaf.

title: Using the Tree Diagram
text: We want to calculate P(N|F). This means we need to first traverse down the tree to the level AFTER we've chosen F (face) for the 1st draw. Once at this level, what's the probability of choosing not a face next?
